questions.question: How many beta particle(s) are emitted in the radioactive decay of $^79_{198}Au←^80_{198}Hg + X?$
questions.correction:
A beta particle forms when a neutron changes into a proton and a high-energy electron. The proton stays in the nucleus but the electron leaves the atom as a beta particle. When a nucleus emits a beta particle, these changes happen:

  • the mass number stays the same
  • the atomic number increases by 1
  • the nuclear charge increases by 1

NB: Usually gold is created from platinum, which has one less proton than gold, or from mercury, which has one more proton than gold. Bombarding a platinum or mercury nucleus with neutrons can knock off an neutron or add on a neutron, which through natural radioactive decay can lead to gold.

Which of the following is stored by dry Leclanche cell?
questions.correction: The Leclanché cell is an electric battery invented and patented by the French scientist Georges Leclanché in 1866. The battery contained a conducting solution (electrolyte) of ammonium chloride, a cathode (positive terminal) of carbon, a depolarizer of manganese dioxide (oxidizer), and an anode (negative terminal) of zinc (reductant). The chemistry of this cell was later successfully adapted to manufacture a dry cell.

Two cars moving in the same direction have speeds of $100kmh^{-1}$ and $130kmh^{-1}$ what is the velocity of the faster car as measured by an observer in the slower car?
questions.correction: Since the cars are moving in the same direction, the velocity of a body A, Va ,relative to another body B, Vb is given by V = Va - Vb ∴ the velocity of faster car is measured by the observer in the slower car is V = $130kmh^{-1}$ - $100 kmh^{-1}$ = $30 kmh^{-1}$

questions.question: A stone and a feather are dropped from the same height above the earth surface. ignoring air resistance, which of the following is correct?
questions.optiona: the feather will be brown away by the wind whilestone will drop steadily
questions.optionb: the stone and the feather will both reach theground a the same time
questions.optionc: the feather will reach the ground first
questions.optiond: the stone will reach the ground first
questions.correction: The acceleration of free fall due to gravity is independent of mass of the body. Therefore, ignoring air resistance, which affects feather more than the stone, the stone and the feather will both reach the ground at the same time

questions.question: A car moves with an initial velocity of $25ms^{-1}$ and reaches a velocity of $45ms^{-1}$ in 10s. what is the acceleration of the car?
questions.correction: Acceleration = (increase in velocity)/time taken = (45 - 25)/10 = (20)/10 = $2ms{-2}$

questions.question: The surfaces of conveyor belts are made rough so as to
questions.optionc: enable them to carry more load
questions.correction: Rough surface promotes friction. Therefore, roughness of conveyor belt prevents the load from slipping

questions.question: A machine of velocity ratio 6 requires an effort of 400 N to raise a load of 800 N through I m. Find the efficiency of the machine
questions.correction: Efficiency = (MA)/V.R x 100% = (load)/Effort x (1)/V.R = (800)/400 x (1)/6 x 100% = 33.3%

questions.question: If a wire 30 cm long is extended to 30.5 cm by a force of 300 N. find the strain energy of wire
questions.correction: Energy stored in a stretched wire (strain energy) = average force x extension = (1)/2 Fe = (1)/2 x 300 N (30.5 - 30.0) x 10-2 m = (300)/2 x 0.5 x 10-2 = 0.75J

questions.question: In a hydraulic press, the pump piston exerts a pressure of 100 pa on the liquid. what force is exerted in the second piston of cross sectional area $3m^2$?
questions.correction: Thrust = pressure x area = 100 pa x $3m^2$ = 300 N

questions.question: The accurate measurement of the relative density of a substance in its powdered form is done with abeam balance and
questions.correction: Since relative density = mass of substance mass of equal volume of water relative density bottle should be used to determine the mass of the substance, and mass of an equal volume of water by filling the bottle with the powder and water respectively and weighed with the beam balance.

questions.question: A hydrometer is an instrument used in measuring
questions.correction: The instrument used in measuring relative density is hydrometer

questions.question: One special advantage of alcohol over mercury as a thermometric liquid is its
questions.correction: The low freezing point of alcohol, -115°c enable low temperatures to be measured. mercury freezes at 39°c, and cannot be used in countries like Russia where winter temperatures of -40°c are common

questions.question: The density of a certain oil on frying becomes $0.4 kgm^-3$ with the volume of $20m^3$ . what will be its initial volume when its initial density is $0.8 kgm^{-3}$ assuming no loss of oil due to spillage?
questions.correction: Density, p = (mass)/volume (m)/(v) 0.4 = (m)/20 ∴ m = 20 x 0.4 = 8 kg V = (m)/p = (8)/0.8 = 10 m3 N:B the units for the options are wrong

questions.question: Heat is radiated by hot objects in the form
questions.correction: Inform falling on the skin causes the skin causes the sensation of warmth. since the objects are hot, the correct option is informed.

questions.question: If a container is filled with ice to the brim, what happens to the level of water when the ice completely melts?
questions.optiona: the level of water goes up
questions.optionb: the water in the glass outflows
questions.optionc: the level of water remains unchanged
questions.correction: Due to anomalous expansion of water at temperature range (0 - 4)°c, when a given mass of water turns into ice, its volume will increase, while the mass remains constant. Thus, when a given volum of ice melts, the volume of water formed will be less than the volume of ice. Hence, the level of water in the container will drop.

questions.question: The small droplet of water that forms on the grass in the early hours of the morning is
questions.correction: Dew point is the temperature at which the water vapour present in air is just sufficient to saturate it. Dew is formed when air is cooled below its dew point

questions.question: The pressure of one mole of an ideal gas of volume $10^{-2}$ m3 at a temperature of 27°c is [molar gas constant = $8.3 J mol^{-1} k^{-1}]$
questions.correction: T = 27 + 273 = 300 K, volume, V = 10-2 m3 molar gass constant, R = 8.3 Jmol- 1k - 1 number of mole, n = 1 PV = NRT i.e P = (NRT)/V = (1 x 8.3 x 300)/10-2 = 2.49 x 105 Nm-1

questions.question: Which of the following has no effect on radiation?
questions.correction: Radiation depends on nature of the surface area and temperature. It is independent of density.

questions.question: The wavelength of a wave traveling with a velocity of $420ms^{-1}$ is 42 m. what is its period?
questions.correction: V = fλ f = (v)/λ = (420)/42 = 10 HZ Period, T = (1)/F = (1)/10 = 0.1 secs

questions.question: The sound of an electricity bell dies down slowly when air is slowly pumped out from a bottle because
questions.optiona: the wavelength of sound becomes greater in thebottle
questions.optionb: sound cannot pass through the bottle
questions.optiond: sound can pass through a vacuum
questions.correction: Sound wave requires a material medium for its propagation. so when air is being pumped out the density of the medium is being reduced and the sound dies down. when all the air has been pumped out of the glass, no sound will be heard, as sound sound cannot travel through vacuum

questions.question: During a thunderstorm, the sound is heard over a long time. this phenomenon is referred to as
questions.correction: The lengthening effect of sound is known as reverberation.

questions.correction: The retina is light sensitive layer living the inner wall of the eye where image is formed. in the camera, image is formed on a light sensitive film

An object is embedded in a block of ice, 10 cm below the plane surface. if the refractive index of the ice is 1.50, the apparent depth below the surface is
questions.correction: Refraction index, n = (real depth)/apparent depth 1.5 = (10)/X X = (10)/1.5 = 6.67 cm

questions.question: Which of the following is used for the correction of short sightedness?
questions.correction: Concave lens diverges parallel rays of light. A short sighted person has the image formed before the retina,and the rays have to be diverged so that they intersect to form image onto the retina

questions.correction: H eat generated in a wire carrying current, H = 12 Rt. so, when voltage is high and current is low heat generated in the wire will be minimal. Therefore, high voltage and low current prevent overheating of the coil.

questions.question: A galvanometer with full-scale deflection of 10 mA is to be converted to a voltmeter with full-scale deflection of 5v. the resistance of the galvanometer is
questions.correction: R = (Vg)/lg = G, where lg = current through galvanometer R = resistance of the multiplier G = resistance of the galvanometer ∴ G = (vg-R)/lg 5(1000/10) - 490 = 500 -490 = 10Ω

questions.question: Two inductors of inductances 5 mll and 15 mll are connected in series and a current of 5A flows through them. the total energy stored in the inductor is
questions.correction: Correct Answer: Option E Total inductance,L = L1 + L2 = m 15 + 5 = 20mH = (20)H/1000 1 = 5A Energy of inductor, (1)/2 L I2 = (1)/2 X (20)/1000 X 5-2 = 0.25 J

questions.question: The ground stated energy for the hydrogen atom is $5.44 x 10^{-19}J$ . If an electron drops from zero energy to ground state, calculate the frequency of the emitted radiation. $[h = 6.6 x 10^{-34} Js]$
questions.correction: Correct Answer: Option E ∆E = hf f = (∆E)/h = (5.44 x 10-19)/6.6 x 10-34 = 8.24 x 1014

questions.question: The diagram above represents balls in an undulating surface. Which of the following option represents positions of stable equilibrium?
questions.correction: A bod y is said to be in stable equilibrium if after a slight displacement, the body returns to its former position. Thus, position III, VI and XI represents position of stable equilibrium

questions.question: A bob of weight 0.1 N hangs from a massless string of length 50 cm. A variable horizontal force which increase from zero is applied to pull the bob until the string makes an angle of $60^o$ with the vertical. The work done is
questions.correction: Length of the string L = y + x = 0.5m ∴ x = L - y = distance moved in the direction of force (which is the weight) when the body is released But cos 60o = y /0.5 ∴ y = 0.5cos60 = 0.5 x 1 /2 = 0.25 ∴ x = l - y = 0.5 - 0.25 = 0.25m Work done = force x distance moved in the direction of force. = 0.1 x 0.25 = 0.0252J

questions.question: Two metals P and Q of length l1 and l2 are heated through the same temperature difference. If the ratio of the linear expansivities of P to Q is 2:3 and the ratio of lengths is 3:4. What is the ratio of increase in length of P to Q?
questions.correction: Metals P, Q original length lP, lQ Increase in length ΔlP, ΔlQ Linear expansivities αP, αQ ∴ αP/αQ = 2 /3 ; and lP/ lQ = 3 /4 But increase in length, Δl = αlΔθ ∴ΔlP = αPlPΔθ ΔlQ = αQlQΔθ ∴ ΔlP = αPlPΔθ = 2 x 3= 1 ΔlQ αQlQΔθ 3 4 2 ∴ Ratio of increase in length of P to Q = 1:2

questions.question: The velocity of sound in air at $16^oC$ is $340ms^{-1}]$ . What will it be when the pressure is doubled and its temperature raised to $127^oC$?
questions.correction: The velocity of sound in air, V∝√T, where T is absolute temperature Thus V = K√T or K = V/T V is independent of pressure and density at a fixed temperature. ∴ V1/√T1 = V2/√T2 T1 = 16 + 273 = 289K, V1 = 340ms-1 T2 = 127 + 273 = 400K, V2 = ? 340 = V2 √289 √400 ∴ V2 = 340√400 _√289 = $400 ms^{-1}$

questions.question: An object is weighted at different locations on the earth. What will be the right observation?
questions.optiona: Both the mass and weight are constant
questions.optionb: Both the mass and weight vary
questions.optionc: the mass is constant while the weight varies
questions.optiond: the weight is constant while the mass varies
questions.correction: The weight of a body is the resultant of earth's gravitational pull on it. The earth is not a perfect sphere, it is more flattened at the poles and bulges at the equator. Hence an object at the pole is closer to the earth's center than the one at the equator. The weight of a body at the poles should be more than that of when weighed at the equator. Thus weight varies from place to place while the mass of a body being the quantity of matter it contains remains the same at different points on the earth.
